messages.message:
Hi there! I'm having some trouble committing things (without `--no-verify`) on my crafting (https://instabase.sandboxes.site/sandboxes/sayanbhattacharjee) env. Have we run into this before? This is a relatively new crafting env and was working up until yesterday. TGhe only thing that's meaningfully changed is that the system had hibernated? and I resumed it
These are the commands I'm running
```(3.9.17) owner@dev:~/instabase$ git commit -m "lint"
`pre-commit` not found.  Did you forget to activate your virtualenv?
(3.9.17) owner@dev:~/instabase$ brew install pre-commit
Command 'brew' not found, did you mean:
  command 'brec' from deb bplay (0.991-10.2)
  command 'qbrew' from deb qbrew (0.4.1-8build1)
Try: sudo apt install <deb name>
(3.9.17) owner@dev:~/instabase$ sudo apt install pre-commit
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree... Done
Reading state information... Done
E: Unable to locate package pre-commit
(3.9.17) owner@dev:~/instabase$ pip install pre-commit
Command 'pip' not found, but can be installed with:
sudo apt install python3-pip
(3.9.17) owner@dev:~/instabase$ sudo apt install python3-pip
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree... Done
Reading state information... Done
E: Unable to locate package python3-pip```

> `pre-commit` not found.  Did you forget to activate your virtualenv
I started to see the same problem this week. This is because python is not found in the `PATH`.
Previously, I saved the `PATH` variable in `.zprofile` . Starting sometime this week, we stopped running `source .zprofile` automatically in new terminals. I have to manually run it.

See this message for the `PATH` variable
https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05L87V014J/p1737056011693069?thread_ts=1736903131.706169&cid=C05L87V014J
so maybe all you need to do is calling `source .bashrc` or `source .bash-profile` ?
Nice, thanks for finding this! This worked :slightly_smiling_face:
